newsitem.title: USA: Neb. cash reserve fund to reach record $132.6 mln.
newsitem.headline: Neb. cash reserve fund to reach record $132.6 mln.

text.p: Nebraska's cash reserve fund balance will reach a record $132.6 million on the strength of a cash infusion of nearly $92 million from fiscal 1997, a status report to Gov. Ben Nelson said.
Nebraska ended the fiscal year earlier this week with a record general fund balance of $355 million, according to the state accounting report released by Nelson Wednesday.

"The economy has allowed us to run state government exactly the way I have repeatedly said it must be run, by spending only what we must, saving what we can and returning the rest to the taxpayer," Nelson said in a statement.
The previous cash reserve fund record was $50.5 million in August 1989. Nebraska had been expected to break the record with an anticipated increase of $58.9 million.
The previous record general fund balance was $290 million set in June 1989.
Nebraska's fiscal 1997-99 budget included $126 million of state income tax reductions and $140 million of local property tax cuts through state aid increases to schools and local governments.
